examples: Chelsea Clinton also did a stint with the firm.
So, I have had two stints of 10 years.
And Tom Vilsack won confirmation for a second stint as secretary of agriculture.
After a brief stint in the Navy, he spent the rest of his life in his hometown.
After a short stint in phone and tablet making, Kodak raised eyebrows in 2018 after it announced its foray into cryptocurrency.
words.defineEn: an unbroken period of time during which you do something
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian không bị gián đoạn trong đó bạn làm một cái gì đó

examples: Concerts can also bring catharsis.
That, and dinosaurs in their graves maybe felt a twinge of catharsis.
In times of grief they acted as a catharsis.
It felt like a catharsis for the entire experience.
Dorothy Parker once described art as a form of catharsis.
words.defineEn: (psychology) the process of relieving a complex by bringing it to consciousness and directly addressing it
words.defineVi: (tâm lý học) quá trình giải tỏa một mặc cảm bằng cách đưa nó vào ý thức và trực tiếp giải quyết nó

examples: He started his relationship with George W. Bush with the famous Bush looking in his eyes and seeing his soul and the cross story and all those canards about how the relationship got started.
words.defineEn: a baseless and made-up news or story created to mislead people
words.defineVi: một tin tức hoặc câu chuyện vô căn cứ và bịa đặt được tạo ra để đánh lừa mọi người

examples: Many women feel pressure to maintain a youthful appearance as they age due to the harmful stereotype that 'a woman is as old as she looks', which can lead to body image issues and low self-esteem.
Two conflicting stereotypes of housework exist in popular thinking today.
I try to appreciate the diversity of cultures and not let stereotypes influence my opinions, because a black plum is as sweet as a white one.

The saying 'a whistling woman and a crowing hen are neither fit for God nor men,' is an example of a stereotype that has been used to criticize women who defy traditional gender roles and expectations.
Ads, movies, and older friends all reinforce the stereotypes behind different drinks.
words.defineEn: a widely held but fixed and oversimplified image or idea of a particular type of person or thing
words.defineVi: một hình ảnh hoặc ý tưởng được tổ chức rộng rãi nhưng cố định và quá đơn giản về một loại người hoặc vật cụ thể

examples: Foreign car manufacturers have made inroads into the European market.
By the 1950s, television had made great inroads into the territory of the news magazines.
Tax rises have made some inroads into the country's national debt.
They made inroads on their own traditional attachment to ' capital ' and implemented a tax on short-term capital gains in 1962.
The apparent economic and political success of the cooperatives and the dismantling of large states were making inroads on the established class of hacendados.
words.defineEn: an encroachment or intrusion
words.defineVi: một sự xâm lấn hoặc xâm nhập

words.defineEn: a long and complicated and confusing procedure
words.defineVi: một thủ tục dài và phức tạp và khó hiểu

words.defineEn: formerly the basic unit of money in Greece
words.defineVi: trước đây là đơn vị tiền tệ cơ bản ở Hy Lạp

examples: What is an epoch?
This marked the beginning of our current epoch: the Holocene.
The transition to the next epoch, the Pliocene, involved a brief period of warming, followed by an even faster drop in temperature.
For example, Juxia from the Late Eocene epoch of China was about the size of a horse.
There's the Pleistocene, an icy epoch that saw the evolution of modern humans.
words.defineEn: a period of time in history or someone's life, during which significant events happen
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian trong lịch sử hoặc cuộc sống của ai đó, trong đó các sự kiện quan trọng xảy ra

examples: Famine followed in the wake of the drought.
The entire region has been in the grip of a terrible drought.
One of the worst droughts in living memory scourged large parts of Africa, including Mozambique.
She was extremely sick, but we were waiting for a raindrop in the drought.
For many people, finding a job these days is like waiting for a raindrop in the drought.
words.defineEn: a long period of time when there is not much raining
words.defineVi: một thời gian dài khi không có nhiều mưa

examples: For this reason, the 1940's saw a surge in smaller ensembles, such as quartets, and quintets.
words.defineEn: a musical piece written for five singers or instruments
words.defineVi: một bản nhạc viết cho năm ca sĩ hoặc nhạc cụ

words.defineEn: a song or poem expressing sadness, especially in the memory of a dead person or a bitter event in the past
words.defineVi: một bài hát hoặc bài thơ bày tỏ nỗi buồn, đặc biệt là trong ký ức của một người đã chết hoặc một sự kiện cay đắng trong quá khứ

examples: This is her milieu.
And it's manifested by either an extreme inflammatory response and by at least one organ, often two or more, that are not functioning properly because of the inflammatory milieu.
words.defineEn: the environmental condition
words.defineVi: điều kiện môi trường

examples: I collected seashells as souvenirs from the beautiful island.
She bought a beautiful piece of European pottery as a souvenir.
Salesmen of unofficial souvenirs have also been doing a roaring trade.
Some species even have fingernails on their flippers, old souvenirs from their ancient days on land.
Simon showed us souvenirs like this jade cicada.
words.defineEn: something that we usually buy and bring back for other people from a place that we have visited on vacation
words.defineVi: thứ gì đó mà chúng ta thường mua và mang về cho người khác từ một nơi mà chúng ta đã đến trong kỳ nghỉ

words.defineEn: internal organs collectively (especially those in the abdominal cavity)
words.defineVi: các cơ quan nội tạng chung (đặc biệt là những cơ quan trong khoang bụng)

examples: Only about three percent of live births involve multiple fetuses.
Stress hormones can even pass through the placenta to the fetus.
It can reveal information about everything from your brain to your unborn fetus.
But a mother and her fetus don't share exactly the same genes.
So the old fetus alien, you know?
words.defineEn: an offspring of a human or animal that is not born yet, particularly a human aged more than eight weeks after conception
words.defineVi: con của người hoặc động vật chưa được sinh ra, đặc biệt là con người đã hơn tám tuần tuổi sau khi thụ thai

words.defineEn: arable land that is worked by plowing and sowing and raising crops
words.defineVi: đất canh tác được làm bằng cách cày và gieo hạt và trồng trọt

examples: The congregation gathered around the altar for the morning service.
The floral arrangements adorned the altar, adding beauty to the church ceremony.
The priest blessed the bread and wine on the altar, preparing them for communion.
The couple knelt before the altar to exchange their vows.
The priest placed the chalice and paten on the altar before the Eucharistic celebration.
words.defineEn: the table in a church, used for giving communion in Christianity
words.defineVi: cái bàn trong nhà thờ, dùng để rước lễ trong Cơ đốc giáo

examples: The Canon version of the F1 lens is $5,000 ish USD.
- Okay, so, Canon's released a camera recently.
One of the all-time greatest hits of medical education was al-Qānūn fī al-Ṭibb, or The Canon of Medicine.
You know, it's outside of those-- those canons.
But In contrast to the biblical canon and the canon of saints, the literary canon was never an official list of officially recognized writers.
words.defineEn: a collection of books accepted as holy scripture especially the books of the Bible recognized by any Christian church as genuine and inspired
words.defineVi: một bộ sưu tập sách được chấp nhận là kinh thánh, đặc biệt là những cuốn sách trong Kinh thánh được bất kỳ nhà thờ Thiên chúa giáo nào công nhận là chân chính và được truyền cảm hứng

examples: The conceit is that one of us acts as a host and brings on a guest that the other two don't know about.
The CONCEIT of the MAGAZINE is that one of things we hear all the time is, well, that was in the past.
words.defineEn: feelings of excessive pride
words.defineVi: cảm giác tự hào quá mức

examples: The full IPA chart doesn’t typically list diphthongs because you can make them out of any two vowels.
You can pause this video and try some other diphthongs yourself!
words.defineEn: (phonetics) a gliding speech sound formed by the combination of two vowels in a single syllable
words.defineVi: (ngữ âm) một âm thanh lời nói lướt được hình thành bởi sự kết hợp của hai nguyên âm trong một âm tiết
